title: Seamus Murphy, PhD
text:
I currently work at Winrock International on the Ecosystem Services team with a focus on jurisdictional REDD+ development & verification.
 
  
   
  
    
     GitHub
  
  
    
     LinkedIn

title: Teaching
text:
I taught in the Statistics Department at Oregon State University from 2011-2022. I continue to host some past course materials:







Statistical Methods I


ST551


Graduate level methods class for statisticians.



Fall 2017










Time Series


ST565


Graduate level class covering exploratory analysis, ARIMA modelling, forecasting and time series regression.



Winter 2016










Statistical Methods II


ST552


Graduate level regression class for statisticians.



Winter 2016










Methods of Data Analysis I


ST511


Graduate level statistical methods class for non-statisticians with a focus on one and two sample problems, ANOVA and simple linear regression.



Fall 2015










Topics in Data Visualization


ST599


Perceptual principles, practice and critique with a focus on creation of graphics using the R package ggplot2.



Summer 2015










Methods of Data Analysis II


ST512


Graduate level statistical methods class with a focus on regression.



Winter 2015










Statistical Computing and Big Data


ST599


Practice based class exposing students to the challenges of working with big data with a focus on teamwork, data science workflow and presentation of results.



Spring 2014






No matching items

title: Workshops
text:
Title



Role



Description



Date








Allometry Validation Requirements


Instructor


Statistical validation and calibration procedures for allometric biomass models compliant with ART-TREES requirements for carbon registry emissions reporting. Technical guidance in model selection methodology is specifically aimed at avoiding Types 1-4 statistical errors and over-fitting. Carbon registries mandate robust model selection protocols to monitor predictive accuracy for signs of systematic bias and apply correction through hyper parameter tuning.


Aug 2024






Integrated Mapping of Wetland Dynamics in an Endorheic Lake Basin: Weaving Remote Sensing & Community Mapping Methods Together


Instructor


Methodological workshop on integrating satellite remote sensing with participatory community mapping to monitor wetland dynamics and fishing activity in Lake Chilwa Basin, Malawi. The workflow combines a longitudinal Landsat time series (1994-2015), Sentinel-1 InSAR data, and extensive mixed-methods fieldwork to examine enforcement conflicts and management opportunities in Africaâ€™s most densely populated wetland ecosystem.


Jan 2020






Monte Carlo REDD+ Uncertainty Analysis: ART-TREES Compliance Tools for Carbon Accounting & MRV Systems


Intstructor


Monte Carlo simulation framework for estimating uncertainty in REDD+ emission factors and activity data for ART-TREES Standard V2.0 compliance, featuring allometric modeling, biomass estimation uncertainty, cross-validation techniques, and automated uncertainty deduction calculations with 90% confidence intervals for jurisdictional and nested carbon verification projects


Dec 2024






ODK-Survey Platform


Instructor


This ODK-derived field survey repository managed data collection for the Empowering Women Fish Retailers in Egypt (EWFIRE) project, sampling socioeconomic data from fish retailers across five urban centers in Sharkia governorate to assess economic constraints and value chain development opportunities informal operators.


Feb 2019
